The one thing that has been rightly expl: When a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption
When a mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of love
When a mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of compassion
When a mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of rejoicing
When a mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of equanimity
When a mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space
When a mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness
When a mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness
The ending of defilements [an11.16:11.3]: Abiding in that they attain the ending of defilements

If they don’t attain the ending of defilements, with the ending of the five lower fetters they’re reborn spontaneously, because of their passion and love for that meditation. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.
The offerings made by the householder Da: He served and satisfied the Saṅgha with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods
He clothed each and every mendicant in a pair of garments
He provided a set of three robes for Ānanda
He had a dwelling worth five hundred built for Ānanda.
